com.barrysheehan.www

Class HeapSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.barrysheehan.www.HeapSort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sorter

    public class HeapSort
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sorter
    Sorts an int[] array using an implementation of Heap Sort, an unstable efficient comparison-based sorting algorithm.

    Heap Sort creates a "heap" or tree structure, pushing the element with the largest value to the "root". It then places this largest value at the end of the sorted array. This process is repeated recursively until the array has been sorted.

    This implementation of the Heap Sort algorithm was written by Sandeep Jain and can be found on GeeksForGeeks.org at the url below. https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/heap-sort/

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Specified by:

      • sort

        public void sort(int[] arr)
        Sorts an array of integers into ascending order using comparisons between elements in the array.

        Considering the input array as a tree structure, iterate over each element which has a child node / is not a leaf node and call the heapify() method on that element.

        Beginning iteration at n / 2 - 1 and count down to 0, considering any element after this index to be a child / leaf node.

        The result of calling the heapify() method on all elements with at least one child will be a "max heap", an array in which the first element is the largest.

        Specified by:
        sort in interface Sorter
        Parameters:
        arr - the integer array to be sorted
